question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the smallest prime divisor of $5^{23} + 7^{17}$?
ground_truth: Since $5^{23}$ and $7^{17}$ are both odd, their sum is even and therefore divisible by 2.  There are no smaller primes than $\boxed{2}$, so it is the smallest prime divisor of the sum.

question:
$$5^{23} + 7^{17} = 10^{20} + 5^{23} - 10^{20} + 7^{17}$$

$$= 5^{23} - 10^{20} + 7^{17}$$

$$= 5^{23} - (2 \cdot 5^{10})^{20} +7^{17}$$

$$= 5^{23} - (2^{20} \cdot 5^{20}) + 7^{17}$$

$$= 5^{23} - 2^{20} \cdot 5^{20} + 7^{17}$$

$$= 5^{20} (5^{3} - 2^{20}) + 7^{17}$$

$$= 5^{20} (-31) + 7^{17}$$

$$= 5^{20} \cdot (-31) + 7^{17}$$

Since $5$ divides $5^{20} (-31)$ and $7$ divides $7^{17}$, their least common multiple $35$ divides $5^{20} (-31) + 7^{17}$

Final Answer: $\boxed{35}.$ I hope it is correct.
